i1.name: Martial Poise
i1.target_range: {{passive progression/deprecated version|4|type=Boots Tier|showtype=true|250 to 350|No Boots;Tier 1 Boots;Tier 2 Boots}}
description:
{{sbc|Innate:}} '''Kalista's''' [[basic attack]] has unique properties:
* Deals {{as|90% AD}} {{as|physical damage}}.
* {{tip|Blind|Misses}} if she loses {{tip|sight}} of her target before they hit.
* Is {{tip|unstoppable basic attack|unstoppable}}.
* Can switch targets mid attack windup.
* Makes her {{tip|dash}} in the target direction after issuing a movement command during a {{tip|attack windup|windup}} or right after casting {{ai|Pierce|Kalista}}.
** The distance scales with her [[Boots]] tier. The windup while dashing is only reduced by {{fd|0.66}}% per {{sti|as|{{tt|{{as|1% '''bonus''' attack speed}}|Compared to the standard 1% per 1%}}}}.
{{sbc|Innate - Oathsworn Bond:}} '''Kalista''' begins the game with an exclusive {{ii|Black Spear}}.
i1.notes: * The dash speed is affected by movement speed modifiers and so it will be reduced by {{tip|slow}}.

q1.name: Pierce
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Kalista''' hurls a spear in the target direction that deals {{as|physical damage}} to the first enemy hit.

If ''Pierce'' kills its target the spear continues onward transferring all of the dead victim's {{ai|Rend|Kalista}} stacks to the next enemy it hits. This can repeat indefinitely until the spear reaches its maximum range.
q1.notes: * ''Pierce'' will cast from wherever '''Kalista''' is at the end of the cast time.

w1.name: Sentinel
description: {{sbc|Passive - Soul-Marked:}} While '''Kalista''' and her {{ii|The Black Spear|Oathsworn}} are linked, their basic attacks and {{ai|Pierce|Kalista}} apply a ''Soul-Mark'' to their targets.

If both ''Soul-Marks'' are applied within 4 seconds, the target takes {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}} (capped against non-champions), and cannot be ''Soul-Marked'' for 10 seconds. ''Soul-Mark'' deals 75 minimum damage to {{tip|minions}} and executes them if they're below {{as|{{sti|health|125 health}}}}. '''Kalista''' applies the damage {{tip|on-attack}} while the ''Oathsworn's'' damage occurs {{tip|on-hit}}.
{{sbc|Passive:}} '''Kalista''' periodically [[stock]]s a ''Sentinel'' charge, up to a maximum of 2.
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Kalista''' summons a ''Sentinel'' to {{tip|sight|patrol}} along the area in the target direction.
leveling: {{st|Bonus Magic Damage|{{as|{{ap|14 to 18}}% of target's '''maximum''' health}}|Maximum Non-Champion Damage|{{ap|100 to 200}}}}
w1.notes:
* ''Soul-Marked's'' bonus damage is credited to '''Kalista''' and will benefit from both her {{sti|magic penetration|{{as|magic penetration}}}} and [[spell effects]].
** If her {{ii|The Black Spear|Oathsworn}} ally scores a kill using ''Soul-Marked's'' bonus damage they will get a message stating 'Kill Secured' in place of the usual gold pop-up (the gold itself is credited to '''Kalista''').
* The ''Sentinel's'' {{tip|sight}} reveal on enemy {{tip|champion|champions}} is accredited for [[assist|assists]] and potentially [[kill|kills]] (if they die shortly after being spotted).
** It does not reveal {{tip|stealth|stealthed}} targets.
* ''Sentinel'' will cast from wherever '''Kalista''' is at the end of the cast time.
* {{Pending for test}}: ''Soul Mark's'' interaction with ''parrying'' effects ({{tip|dodge}}, {{tip|block}}, {{tip|blind}}).
* {{pending for test}} If ''Pierce'' kills the target by ''Soul-Mark's'' additional damage, it will/will not continue.

effects.levelingtext: {{st|Bonus Magic Damage|{{as|{{ap|14 to 18}}% of target's '''maximum''' health}}|Maximum Non-Champion Damage|{{ap|100 to 200}}}}
effects.str:
• Bonus Magic Damage: % of target's maximum health
  • Maximum Non-Champion Damage:

e1.name: Rend
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Kalista's''' basic attacks {{tip|on-hit}} and {{ai|Pierce|Kalista}} lodge a spear into their target for 4 seconds, [[stack]]ing up to 254 times, with the duration refreshing on subsequent attacks and hits of {{ai|Pierce|Kalista}}.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Kalista''' rips all lodged spears from valid nearby enemies, consuming their stacks to deal them {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|slow}} them for 2 seconds. The damage is increased with additional spears, but with reduced efficiency. ''Rend'' deals 50% reduced damage against epic {{tip|monsters}}.
''Rend'' resets its {{sti|cooldown}} and refunds {{sti|{{as|mana}}}} if it [[kill]]s at least one target.
''There must be at least one valid target nearby for Rend to be cast.''

''Rend'' can be used during the dash of {{ai|Martial Poise|Kalista}} and the cast time of {{ai|Pierce|Kalista}}. In-flight spears and {{ai|Pierce|Kalista}} if in cast will be empowered to apply ''Rend's'' effects to their targets. These empowered spears can also trigger ''Rend's'' refund.
e1.notes:
* ''Rend'' at maximum stacks will deal a total of {{as|{{ap|(20 to 60)+(10+3*(x-1)+x*(x-1)/2)*253}}|physical damage}} {{as|(+ {{ap|60*(1+0.33*253)|60*(1+0.3958*253) to 60*(1+0.5833*253) 4}}% AD)}} {{as|physical damage}}.
* ''Rend'' cannot activate on {{tip|untargetable}} enemies.
* ''Rend'' applies its effects instantly on cast.
* The cooldown will not reset if the target is protected by {{tip|resurrection}} effects.
* If ''Rend'' is used against {{ci|Sion}} under the effects of {{ai|Glory in Death|Sion}}, the cooldown will reset even if it does not kill him.
* A stack is not applied if the attack is {{tip|dodge|dodged}}, {{tip|block|blocked}} or missed while '''Kalista''' is {{tip|blind|blinded}}. 
* {{Pending for test}}: {{ai|Pierce|Kalista}} does not apply a stack of ''Rend'' if blocked by {{tip|spell shield}}.
e1.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '{{ap|14 to 8}}' as '14/12.5/11/9.5/8' and riot's value '0,0,0,0,0' as '0'

effects.str:
• Physical Damage: (+ 60% AD)
  • Damage per Additional Spear: (+ % AD)

  • Slow: %

r1.name: Fate's Call
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Kalista''' invokes her {{ii|The Black Spear|link}}, retrieving and dragging her ''Oathsworn'' to her over 1 second and {{tip|cleanse|cleansing}} them from all {{tip|crowd control}} while rendering them {{tip|invulnerable}} and {{tip|untargetable}} for 4 seconds.

'''Kalista's''' ''Oathsworn'' can {{tip|dash}} with {{tip|displacement immunity}} to a target location during this time, and automatically does so at the end of the duration, ending ''Fate's Call's'' effects and stopping at the first enemy {{tip|champion}} hit, {{tip|airborne|knocking up}} all surrounding enemies and landing themselves at their {{sti|attack range|basic attack range}} relative to the target hit.

''The Oathsworn {{tip|vanish|vanishes}} upon retrieval and remains so until they have emerged, and is also {{tip|silence|silenced}} and unable to perform movement or attack commands during the entire effect.''
r1.notes:
* The following will defer ''Fate's Call's'' effects at the time of cast to the end of ''their duration'' if the ''Oathsworn'' is:
** In a [[Channel#Casting Times|cast time]].
** {{tip|Channel|Channeling}}.
*** ''Fate's Call'' will not defer by the following channels: {{si|Recall}}, {{ai|Abyssal Voyage|Tahm Kench}} (first channel), {{ai|Defiant Dance|Irelia}}, {{ai|Realm Warp|Ryze}}, and {{ai|The Culling|Lucian}}.
*** ''Fate's Call'' cannot be cast during the following channels: {{si|Teleport}}, {{ai|Abyssal Voyage|Tahm Kench}} (second channel), {{ai|Gate|Twisted Fate}}, {{ai|Grand Starfall|Pantheon}}, {{ai|Hero's Entrance|Galio}} and {{ai|Stand United|Shen}}.
** {{tip|Displacement immune}}.
** Performing {{ai|Chaaaaaaaarge!!!|Kled}}, {{ai|Stormbringer|Volibear}}, {{ai|The Darkin Scythe|Kayn|Transformation}}, or {{ai|Umbral Trespass|Kayn}}. {{tt|*|These abilities are special cased to not be invoked. This is not complete, others are pending for test.}}
* ''Fate's Call'' will not drag the ''Oathsworn'' if they are {{tip|dash|dashing}} but they will be retrieved after 1 second regardless.
* ''Fate's Call'' will pull the ''Oathsworn'' even if they are {{tip|untargetable}}.
* ''Fate's Call'' is disabled if the ''Oathsworn'' is {{tip|resurrection|resurrecting}}.
* ''Fate's Call'' can be used even if the ''Oathsworn'' is in a {{tip|zombie state}}.
* The ''Oathsworn'' being held is represented by a light over '''Kalista's''' head.
* '''Kalista's''' [[death]] does not cancel ''Fate's Call''.
* ''Fate's Call'' cannot be cast without the ''Oathsworn'' nearby.
